title: Translanguaging-Based Mathematics Instructional Design for Multilingual Learners in Large-Scale Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of elementary mathematical concepts and basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: Learning process where learners with diverse linguistic backgrounds connect mathematical concepts through their native languages, performing real-life problem-solving projects via backward design

learning_goals: Learners can apply translanguaging strategies to explain mathematical concepts using their native language and second language with over 80% accuracy
Learners can document mathematical problem-solving processes using multilingual resources provided by the LMS platform
Learners can transform real-life problems into mathematical models and collaboratively solve them with peer learners through translanguaging techniques
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
